com.gieseckedevrient.smartcard
Class SEService

java.lang.Object
  com.gieseckedevrient.smartcard.SEService

public class SEService
extends java.lang.Object

This SEService realizes the communication to available Secure Elements on the phone. This class returns a set of Secure Element Reader proxy instances that can be used for the communication with the different Secure Elements.

Nested Class Summary
static interface SEService.CallBack
          Callback interface if informs that this SEService is connected to the backend system and it's resources.

Constructor Detail

SEService

public SEService(Context context,
                 SEService.CallBack callback)
Establishes a new SEService that can be used to access all Secure Elements available in the system.

Note that this SEService performs an internal connecting process to a backend system. It has to be considered that this initialization process can take same time. After the establishment of a connection the caller will be informed by the defined callback parameter.

Parameters:
context - the context (activity) which is bound to this service.
This means that only this activity can use this service. If the activity dies this service cleans up all allocated resources. Must not be null.
callback - the callback informs if this SEService is connected to the back end system. After the establishment of this connection this SEService can be used for the communication with an SE device. The established connection can be closed with shutdown().
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - this SEService does not have the permission to bind the backend.
Method Detail

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Indicates if this SEService is connected to the backend system.

Returns:
true if this SEService is connected. otherwise false

getReaders

public Reader[] getReaders()
                    throws java.io.IOException
Returns all available Secure Element Readers.

Returns:
a set of Secure Element Readers.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this SEService is not connected.
java.io.IOException - if a communication error within the SEService occurs.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Disconnects this SEService from the backend system and releases all Secure Elements resources allocated by this SEService. It is recommended to call this method in the onDestroy() method of the calling activity which is bound to this SEService.
